intro: Hibbertia kaputarensis, commonly known as the Kaputare sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to Queensland, Australia. It is a low-growing shrub with pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to sandy soils in arid environments. Hibbertia kaputarensis is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its resilience to drought. It plays an important role in stabilizing coastal and sandy habitats.
